revision.comment: Fix styling to show sort icon
revision.text:
This is a '''list of NGC objects 1–1000''' from the [[New General Catalogue]] (NGC). The [[astronomical catalog]]ue is composed mainly of [[star cluster]]s, [[nebula]]e, and [[galaxies]]. Other objects in the catalogue can be found in the other subpages of the [[list of NGC objects]].
The constellation information in these tables is from ''The Complete New General Catalogue and Index Catalogue of Nebulae and Star Clusters by J. L. E. Dreyer'',<ref name="sinnott1988"> {{cite book |author=R. W. Sinnott, editor |title=The Complete New General Catalogue and Index Catalogue of Nebulae and Star Clusters by J. L. E. Dreyer |date=1988 |publisher=Sky Publishing Corporation and Cambridge University Press |isbn=978-0-933346-51-2 }}</ref> which was accessed using the VizieR Service.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://vizier.u-strasbg.fr/viz-bin/VizieR |title=VizieR Service |work=Strasbourg astronomical Data Center |accessdate=18 August 2015}}</ref> Galaxy morphological types and objects that are members of the [[Small Magellanic Cloud]] are identified using the ''NASA/IPAC Extragalactic Database''.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://nedwww.ipac.caltech.edu/ |title=NED |work=NED–NASA/IPAC Extragalactic Database |accessdate=18 August 2015}}</ref> The other data of these tables are from the [[SIMBAD Astronomical Database]]<ref>{{cite web |url=http://simbad.u-strasbg.fr/simbad/ |title=SIMBAD Astronomical Database |work=Strasbourg astronomical Data Center |accessdate=18 August 2015}}</ref> unless otherwise stated.

This is a '''list of NGC objects 1001–2000''' from the [[New General Catalogue]] (NGC). The [[astronomical catalog]]ue is composed mainly of [[star cluster]]s, [[nebula]]e, and [[galaxies]]. Other objects in the catalogue can be found in the other subpages of the [[list of NGC objects]].
The constellation information in these tables is taken from ''The Complete New General Catalogue and Index Catalogue of Nebulae and Star Clusters by J. L. E. Dreyer'',<ref name="sinnott1988"> {{cite book |author=R. W. Sinnott, editor |title=The Complete New General Catalogue and Index Catalogue of Nebulae and Star Clusters by J. L. E. Dreyer |year=1988 |publisher=Sky Publishing Corporation and Cambridge University Press |isbn=978-0-933346-51-2 }}</ref> which was accessed using the "VizieR Service".<ref>{{cite web |url=http://vizier.u-strasbg.fr/viz-bin/VizieR |title=VizieR Service |work=Strasbourg astronomical Data Center |accessdate=18 August 2015}}</ref> Galaxy morphological types and objects that are members of the [[Large Magellanic Cloud]] are identified using the ''NASA/IPAC Extragalactic Database''.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://nedwww.ipac.caltech.edu/ |title=NED |work=NED–NASA/IPAC Extragalactic Database |accessdate=18 August 2015}}</ref> The other data of these tables are from Wolfgang Steinicke's ''Revised New General Catalogue and Index Catalogue''<ref>{{cite web|author=Dr. Wolfgang Steinicke|title=Astronomie-Homepage von Wolfgang Steinicke|url=http://www.klima-luft.de/steinicke/index_e.htm|accessdate=14 February 2017}}</ref> and/or the [[SIMBAD Astronomical Database]]<ref name=SIMBAD>{{cite web |url=http://simbad.u-strasbg.fr/simbad/ |title=SIMBAD Astronomical Database |work=Strasbourg astronomical Data Center |accessdate=18 August 2015}}</ref> unless otherwise stated.

revision.text:
This is a '''list of NGC objects 2001–3000''' from the [[New General Catalogue]] (NGC). The [[astronomical catalog]]ue is composed mainly of [[star cluster]]s, [[nebula]]e, and [[galaxies]]. Other objects in the catalogue can be found in the other subpages of the [[list of NGC objects]]. The constellation information in these tables is taken from ''The Complete New General Catalogue and Index Catalogue of Nebulae and Star Clusters by J. L. E. Dreyer'', {{cite book |author=R. W. Sinnott, editor |title=The Complete New General Catalogue and Index Catalogue of Nebulae and Star Clusters by J. L. E. Dreyer |year=1988 |publisher=Sky Publishing Corporation and Cambridge University Press |isbn=978-0-933346-51-2 }} which was accessed using the "VizieR Service".{{cite web |url=http://vizier.u-strasbg.fr/viz-bin/VizieR |title=VizieR Service |work=Strasbourg astronomical Data Center |accessdate=18 August 2015}} Galaxy types are identified using the ''NASA/IPAC Extragalactic Database''.{{cite web |url=http://nedwww.ipac.caltech.edu/ |title=NED |work=NED–NASA/IPAC Extragalactic Database |accessdate=18 August 2015}} The other data of these tables are from the [[SIMBAD Astronomical Database]]{{cite web |url=http://simbad.u-strasbg.fr/simbad/ |title=SIMBAD Astronomical Database |work=Strasbourg astronomical Data Center |accessdate=18 August 2015}} unless otherwise stated. ==2001–2100== {| class="wikitable sortable" style="text-align: center;" ! style="background-color:#edf3fe; width: 10%;" | NGC number ! style="background-color:#edf3fe; width: 15%;" | [[File:NGC 3244.tif|thumb|260px|Image of the spiral galaxy [[NGC 3244]] was taken with the help of the President of the Czech Republic, [[Václav Klaus]], during his visit to [[ESO]]'s [[Paranal Observatory]]{{cite journal |title=President of Czech Republic visits ESO's Paranal Observatory |pages=12|url=http://www.eso.org/public/news/eso1112/|journal=ESO Organisation Release |accessdate=16 May 2011|bibcode=2011eso..pres...12.|year=2011}}]] This is a '''list of NGC objects 3001–4000''' from the [[New General Catalogue]] (NGC). The [[astronomical catalog]]ue is composed mainly of [[star cluster]]s, [[nebula]]e, and [[galaxies]]. Other objects in the catalogue can be found in the other subpages of the [[list of NGC objects]]. The constellation information in these tables is taken from ''The Complete New General Catalogue and Index Catalogue of Nebulae and Star Clusters by J. L. E. Dreyer'', {{cite book |author=R. W. Sinnott, editor |title=The Complete New General Catalogue and Index Catalogue of Nebulae and Star Clusters by J. L. E. Dreyer |date=1988 |publisher=Sky Publishing Corporation and Cambridge University Press |isbn=978-0-933346-51-2 }} which was accessed using the "VizieR Service".{{cite web |url=http://vizier.u-strasbg.fr/viz-bin/VizieR |title=VizieR Service |work=Strasbourg astronomical Data Center |accessdate=18 August 2015}} Galaxy types are identified using the ''NASA/IPAC Extragalactic Database''.{{cite web |url=http://nedwww.ipac.caltech.edu/ |title=NED |work=NED–NASA/IPAC Extragalactic Database |accessdate=18 August 2015}} The other data of these tables are from the [[SIMBAD Astronomical Database]]{{cite web |url=http://simbad.u-strasbg.fr/simbad/ |title=SIMBAD Astronomical Database |work=Strasbourg astronomical Data Center |accessdate=18 August 2015}} unless This is a '''list of NGC objects 4001–5000''' from the [[New General Catalogue]] (NGC). The [[astronomical catalog]]ue is composed mainly of [[star cluster]]s, [[nebula]]e, and [[galaxies]]. Other objects in the catalogue can be found in the other subpages of the [[list of NGC objects]]. The constellation information in these tables is taken from ''The Complete New General Catalogue and Index Catalogue of Nebulae and Star Clusters by Jjiko. L. E. Dreyer'', {{cite book |author=R. W. Sinnott, editor |title=The Complete New General Catalogue and Index Catalogue of Nebulae and Star Clusters by J. L. E. Dreyer |date=1988 |publisher=Sky Publishing Corporation and Cambridge University Press |isbn=978-0-933346-51-2 }} which was accessed using the "VizieR Service".{{cite web |url=http://vizier.u-strasbg.fr/viz-bin/VizieR |title=VizieR Service |work=Strasbourg astronomical Data Center |accessdate=18 August 2015}} Galaxy types are identified using the ''NASA/IPAC Extragalactic Database''.{{cite web |url=http://nedwww.ipac.caltech.edu/ |title=NED |work=NED–NASA/IPAC Extragalactic Database |accessdate=18 August 2015}} The other data of these tables are from the [[SIMBAD Astronomical Database]]{{cite web |url=http://simbad.u-strasbg.fr/simbad/ |title=SIMBAD Astronomical Database |work=Strasbourg astronomical Data Center |accessdate=18 August 2015}} unless revision.text:
This is a '''list of NGC objects 5001–6000''' from the [[New General Catalogue]] (NGC). The [[astronomical catalog]]ue is composed mainly of [[star cluster]]s, [[nebula]]e, and [[galaxies]]. Other objects in the catalogue can be found in the other subpages of the [[list of NGC objects]]. The constellation information in these tables is taken from ''The Complete New General Catalogue and Index Catalogue of Nebulae and Star Clusters by J. L. E. Dreyer'', {{cite book |author=R. W. Sinnott, editor |title=The Complete New General Catalogue and Index Catalogue of Nebulae and Star Clusters by J. L. E. Dreyer |date=1988 |publisher=Sky Publishing Corporation and Cambridge University Press |isbn=978-0-933346-51-2 }} which was accessed using the "VizieR Service".{{cite web |url=http://vizier.u-strasbg.fr/viz-bin/VizieR |title=VizieR Service |work=Strasbourg astronomical Data Center |accessdate=18 August 2015}} Galaxy types are identified using the ''NASA/IPAC Extragalactic Database''.{{cite web |url=http://nedwww.ipac.caltech.edu/ |title=NED |work=NED–NASA/IPAC Extragalactic Database |accessdate=18 August 2015}} The other data of these tables are from the [[SIMBAD Astronomical Database]]{{cite web |url=http://simbad.u-strasbg.fr/simbad/ |title=SIMBAD Astronomical Database |work=Strasbourg astronomical Data Center |accessdate=18 August 2015}} unless otherwise stated. ==5001–5100== {| class="wikitable sortable" style="text-align: center;" ! 5001-6000]]

This is a '''list of NGC objects 6001–7000''' from the [[New General Catalogue]] (NGC). The [[astronomical catalog]]ue is composed mainly of [[star cluster]]s, [[nebula]]e, and [[galaxies]]. Other objects in the catalogue can be found in the other subpages of the [[list of NGC objects]]. The constellation information in these tables is taken from ''The Complete New General Catalogue and Index Catalogue of Nebulae and Star Clusters by J. L. E. Dreyer'', {{cite book |author=R. W. Sinnott, editor |title=The Complete New General Catalogue and Index Catalogue of Nebulae and Star Clusters by J. L. E.
